intro: Galium setuliflorum var. nudiflorum, commonly known as the nakedflower bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often covered in fine, hairy glands, giving it a distinctive appearance.
